intro: Boisduvalia cleistogama, commonly known as the cleistogamous boisduvalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique reproductive strategy, producing closed, self-pollinating flowers that do not open. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into capsule fruits. This species is of interest to botanists due to its specialized pollination mechanism and ecological adaptations.
